formalpara.title: Figure 2. C. elegans Eph receptor signaling showing proteins that directly interact with VAB-1
formalpara.para: The genome encodes one Eph receptor called VAB-1, four GPI-linked ephrins called EFN-1 to EFN-4, and numerous proteins with MSP domains (George et al., 1998; Chin-Sang et al., 1999; Wang et al., 1999; Tarr and Scott, 2005). MSP domains directly interact with the VAB-1 extracellular domain and can function as ephrin antagonists, as well as signal independent of ephrins (Miller et al., 2003; Govindan et al., 2006; Tsuda et al., 2008; Chen and Chan, 2009). The VAB-1 intracellular domain directly interacts with the Disabled homolog DAB-1 (Cheng et al., 2008), Ran GTPase RAN-1 (Cheng et al., 2008), PTEN homolog DAF-18 (Brisbin et al., 2009), and a complex containing the NCK-1 adaptor protein and WSP-1 WASP homolog (Mohamed et al., 2012).
